senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>submarine</w> sandwich; a long bread roll split open and filled with meat, cheese, and vegetables.

examples.text: We decided to go to the deli and buy some <w>subs</w> for lunch.
I ordered a turkey <w>sub</w> with extra cheese and pickles.

senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>substitute</w>; a person who replaces someone else for a short time, especially a teacher or a sports player.

examples.text: Our regular teacher is sick, so we have a <w>sub</w> today.
The coach sent in a <w>sub</w> during the second half of the game.

senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>submarine</w>; a ship that can travel underwater.

examples.text: The crew lived on the <w>sub</w> for three months without seeing the sun.
They spotted an enemy <w>sub</w> on the radar screen.

senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>subscription</w>; a payment for a service or a person who follows an online channel.

examples.text: I forgot to renew my magazine <w>sub</w> before it expired.
The video channel gained a thousand new <w>subs</w> in one week.

senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>subtitle</w>; text displayed at the bottom of a screen translating or transcribing the dialogue.

examples.text: I prefer watching foreign films with <w>subs</w> rather than dubbed audio.
There was a mistake in the <w>subs</w> that changed the meaning of the scene.

senses.sense_definition: Short form of <w>subcontractor</w>; a person or company hired to do part of a job for another contractor.

examples.text: The main builder hired a <w>sub</w> to handle the electrical wiring.
We need to find a reliable <w>sub</w> to finish the roofing work.

senses.sense_definition: To perform the duties of another person temporarily, especially as a teacher or in a sports game.

examples.text: Can you <w>sub</w> for me at work tomorrow morning?
He was <w>subbed</w> into the match during the final ten minutes.
